trajectory.errorInfo: <|feedback|>Action: "navigate to" is illegal, "Apple" is the most relevant item in this room and "navigate to apple". Object: "Apple" is not currently navigable, you can try "navigate to <object>" to reach nearby, larger objects for closer observation.

<|feedback|>Action: pickup apple is illegal, Object: Apple is currently unavailable for interaction. Possible situations include: Apple does not exist in your current view; you are too far away from Apple; the Apple cannot perform operation pickup.
You can try "move forward" to approach the target object or "navigate to <object>" to reach nearby, larger objects for closer inspection.

messages.content: You are a robot in given room. You need to complete the tasks according to human instructions. We provide an Available_Actions set and the corresponding explanations for each action. Each step, you should select one action from Available_Actions.

<image>This is an image from your frontal perspective. Please select an action from the Available_Actions and fill in the arguments.
Task: "Can you grab the Apple from the room?"
Available_Actions: {
"navigate to <object>": Move to the object.
"pickup <object>": Pick up the object.
"put in <object>": Put the item in your hand into or on the object.
"toggle <object>": Switch the object on or off.
"open <object>": Open the object (container), and you will see inside the object.
"close <object>": Close the object.
"observe": You can obtain image of your directly rear, left, and right perspectives.
"move forward": Move forward to see more clearly.
"end": If you think you have completed the task, please output "end".}
Before making each decision, you can think, plan, and even reflect step by step, and then output your final action.
Your final action must strictly follow format: <DecisionMaking>Your Action</DecisionMaking>, for example, <DecisionMaking>observe</DecisionMaking>.
<DecisionMaking>navigate to apple</DecisionMaking>

<|feedback|>Action: "navigate to" is illegal, "Apple" is the most relevant item in this room and "navigate to apple". Object: "Apple" is not currently navigable, you can try "navigate to <object>" to reach nearby, larger objects for closer observation.
To complete your task, you can think step by step at first and then output your new action from the Available_Actions.
Your action must strictly follow format: <DecisionMaking>Your Action</DecisionMaking>, for example, <DecisionMaking>observe</DecisionMaking>.
<DecisionMaking>navigate to countertop</DecisionMaking>

<image>After executing your previous "navigate to CounterTop", you get this new image above.
To complete your task, you can think step by step at first and then output your new action from the Available_Actions.
Your action must strictly follow format: <DecisionMaking>Your Action</DecisionMaking>, for example, <DecisionMaking>observe</DecisionMaking>.
<DecisionMaking>pickup apple</DecisionMaking>

<|feedback|>Action: pickup apple is illegal, Object: Apple is currently unavailable for interaction. Possible situations include: Apple does not exist in your current view; you are too far away from Apple; the Apple cannot perform operation pickup.
You can try "move forward" to approach the target object or "navigate to <object>" to reach nearby, larger objects for closer inspection.To complete your task, you can think step by step at first and then output your new action from the Available_Actions.
Your action must strictly follow format: <DecisionMaking>Your Action</DecisionMaking>, for example, <DecisionMaking>observe</DecisionMaking>.
